column4: i just installed ubuntu on a machine that i already had ubuntu on. i switched out the hdds. ubuntu installs to the new hdd just fine, but when it goes to boot up, i get an error: "Filesystem type unknown, partition type 0x7"... "Error 17: Cannot mount selected partition"... windows XP installs and boots up to this drive just fine. any ideas where i'm going wrong with ubuntu?
hmm... that's a weird one. tried reinstalling ubuntu? made sure the cd integrity check passes before installing?
yes. i've also tried debian and that fails as well. i'd guess it's an hdd issue, but it works fine with windows xp
hm, in that case, no idea...
